title: Coriander Chutney

ingredients.content: 100 g fresh coriander, leaves and stalks
1 - 2 fresh green chillies, halved, deseeded, to taste

preparations.content: Place onions, coriander, lemon juice and chillies in mixing bowl then chop <b>7 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then chop again <b>5 sec/speed 4<b>.

Add salt and sugar then blend <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then blend again <b>3 sec/speed 8<b>. Transfer to a serving bowl, cover with cling film and refrigerate until ready to serve.

hintsAndTricks: <b>C<b>hutney in an Indian recipe is usually a fresh condiment, unlike a western chutney which is a preserved dish. Coriander, lemon and chilli give this beautifully fresh accompaniment a lovely zing. Serve alongside a variety of curries including chicken tikka or aloo gobi (see recipes).
